name: Analakely Market
description: Antananarivo's iconic open-air market, bustling with local artisans, produce, and street food that captures the city's daily rhythm.

name: Rova of Antananarivo
description: The historic royal palace complex perched above the capital, offering panoramic views and insights into Malagasy monarchy.

name: Ambohimanga Sacred Hill
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site and spiritual heartland revered for its preserved royal city and lush forested slopes.

name: Lemurs' Park
description: A private reserve home to nine lemur species, showcasing Madagascar's biodiversity in a protected riverside habitat.

name: Avenue of the Baobabs
description: Majestic centuries-old baobab trees lining a red earth road, forming one of Madagascar's most photographed landscapes.

name: La Digue Handicraft Market
description: A cooperative market where artisans sell carved wood, basketry, and jewelry, ideal for sourcing member gift collections.

name: Piratenmuseum in Madagascar
description: Interactive exhibits narrate the island's pirate lore, colonial trade, and maritime heritage in a family-friendly setting.

name: Madagascar Cuisine Studio
description: A cooperative kitchen offering cooking workshops and tasting menus celebrating contemporary takes on Malagasy staples.
